description:
Population in families / living arrangements

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
The basis for representing microcensus results according to
the living arrangements concept is the population in
families / living arrangements at their main residence. The
population in families / living arrangements at their main
residence does not include the population in collective
living quarters (for example, old peoples' homes). The
population in families / living arrangements at their main
residence includes all members of a family / living
arrangement (for example, cohabiting couple with children)
whose reference person lives at the main residence,
irrespective of where they stay at the reference date. This
means that individual members of the family / living
arrangement may live at a second residence while, at the
same time, they are counted as part of the population in
families / living arrangements at their main residence, as
this is the residence of the reference person of their
family / living arrangement. At the same time, the living
arrangement examined can be represented as a closed unit
belonging together, even if individual members are
temporarily absent.
